intro: Ardisia feniana, commonly known as the purple-leafed ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with a reddish-purple underside. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Ardisia feniana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
